Taking the code from and we can create something a little more complex. This time we will embedd a component into the helloWipeout application.

Modify the template of the root application

Our application will now contain a collapsable, which shows or hides the collapsableContent of the root model. When setting the model of the collapsale, $parent refers to the view model which the collapsable will be embedded into, in this case, the applicaiton

<script type="text/xml" id="helloWipeout.rootApplication"> <div> Hello <span data-bind="text: model().name"></span>! <br /> <helloWipeout.collapsable model="$parent.model().collapsableContent"></helloWipeout.collapsable> </div> </script>

Modify the application definition

We now need to define the collapsableContent which we referenced in the modified template.

<div id="helloWipeoutApp" data-bind="wipeout: helloWipeout.rootApplication"></div> <script type="text/javascript"> var rootApp = document.getElementById("helloWipeoutApp"); ko.applyBindings({ name: "Wipeout", collapsableContent: "This is the text to show/hide" }, rootApp); </script>

And that is it. Collapsable component added! The resulting content will render like this:

// create a namespace for the application window.helloWipeout = {}; // create a custom view model which inherits from wo.view helloWipeout.collapsable = wo.view.extend(function() { // call wo.view constructor and give the template id for this view model this._super("collapsable_template"); this.open = true; }); // a function which will show or hide the collapsable content helloWipeout.collapsable.prototype.toggle = function() { // "colapsableContent" is the id of the div to show/hide in the template for this view model if(this.open) this.templateItems.colapsableContent.style.display = "none"; else this.templateItems.colapsableContent.style.display = null; this.open = !this.open; }; helloWipeout.rootApplication = wo.view.extend(function () { // call the base constructor. The constructor for wo.view takes in a template id. this._super("helloWipeout.rootApplication"); }); <script type="text/xml" id="collapsable_template"> <!-- a link bound to the toggle function of the view model --> <a href="javascript: void(0)" data-bind="click: toggle">Toggle</a> <!-- a div whos content is bound to the model of the view model. Its id is used to find this element within the view model --> <div data-bind="html: model" id="colapsableContent"></div> </script>
<helloWipeout.rootApplication model="{ name: 'Wipeout', collapsableContent: 'This is the text to show/hide' }"></helloWipeout.rootApplication>

And if you were really adventurous you could use a browser debugger to have a look at the markup for the above application:

<!-- ko wipeout-type: helloWipeout.rootApplication--> <div>Hello <span>Wipeout</span>! <br> <!-- ko wipeout-type: helloWipeout.collapsable--> <!-- a link bound to the toggle function of the view model --> <a href="javascript: void(0)">Toggle</a> <!-- a div whos content is bound to the model of the view model. Its id is used to find this element within the view model --> <div id="colapsableContent">This is the text to show/hide</div> <!-- /ko --> </div> <!-- /ko -->
